meanings.sent1: The dark room became illuminable once the light was turned on.
meanings.sent2: The lantern had an illuminable feature that made it perfect for camping.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a way to make the normally illuminable lampshade into a cozy hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an illuminable beacon in the crowd, drawing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the night sky were so illuminable, they seemed to twinkle with joy.

meanings.sent1: The street was dark until the illuminable streetlights turned on.
meanings.sent2: The fireflies' illuminable bodies created a magical glow in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The illuminable disco ball added a fun touch to the party decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like two illuminable orbs, shining with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The neon sign was so illuminable that it could be seen from miles away.

meanings.sent1: The dull room became illuminable with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent2: The sky at dawn had an illuminable quality as the sun started to rise.
meanings.sent3: The illuminable flowers in the garden seemed to brighten up the entire yard.
meanings.sent4: His future looked illuminable as he worked hard towards his goals.
meanings.sent5: The gemstone had an illuminable sparkle that caught everyone's eye.
